DOC.brief_summary: Early mechanical ventilation, if delivered with injurious settings, can lead to pulmonary complications, such as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). Mechanical ventilation in the emergency department (ED) has been studied infrequently when compared to the intensive care unit; however, data suggests that ED-based mechanical ventilation has significant room for improvement and may also be a causative factor in ARDS incidence.
DOC.brief_title: ED Lung Protective Ventilation to Reduce Complications
DOC.criteria: mechanically ventilated via an endotracheal tube in the ED death in the ED, death or discontinuation of ventilation within 24 hours, chronic mechanical ventilation, transfer to another hospital.
